title: Woman dies after crashing her car into a fire truck at a busy intersection in Canberra
text:
Police are currently on the scene speaking with witnesses of the horror collision

The female driver of the car was taken to hospital where she later died

Emergency crews were called to an intersection in Barton, Canberra at 2pm

A woman has died in hospital after crashing her car into a fire truck at a busy intersection in Canberra on Monday afternoon.

Emergency services were called to the intersection of Bowen Drive and Brisbane Avenue in Barton at around 2pm.

Detective Acting Station Sergeant Marcus Boorman said the intersection will be closed for several hours as police investigate what cause the horror collision.

'The driver of the vehicle that was struck by the fire truck sustained serious injuries and tragically has passed away at hospital later this afternoon,' Sgt Boorman said.

A woman has died in hospital after crashing her car into a fire truck at a busy intersection in Canberra on Monday afternoon

Police are currently on the scene speaking with witnesses of the crash. They have encouraged anyone with information to contact them.

'With any incident like this, we look at so many things,' Sgt Boorman said.

'We can map the scene, we look at speeds ... [we] speak to witnesses - so it's a long process, but it's so important that we do it right because we get one shot.'

'Our thoughts go out to the family of the driver and also I'd like people to spare a thought for the emergency services personnel that are involved in these incidents.'

ACT Police have advised motorists to avoid Brisbane Avenue, Wentworth Avenue and Macquarie Street with heavy delays in place.

More to come.
description: Emergency services were called to the intersection of Bowen Drive and Brisbane Avenue in Barton at around 2pm. The driver of the car later died in hospital.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
